alert.note: Alert for Barren; Cumberland; Metcalfe; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL MONROE...WESTERN CUMBERLAND...SOUTHEASTERN BARREN AND SOUTHWESTERN METCALFE COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 252 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Tompkinsville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tompkinsville, Leslie, Waterview, Eighty Eight, Meshack, Persimmon, Cyclone, Forkton, Blythe and Sulphur Lick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
